jsat.graphing

Class Graph2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • jsat.graphing.Graph2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CategoryPlot, Histogram, ParallelCoordinatesPlot, QQPlotData, QQPlotDistribution, ReachabilityPlot, ROCPlot, ScatterPlot

    public class Graph2D
extends javax.swing.JComponent
    Graph2D is a component for drawing using x and y numeric values, that will be automatically converted into the correct coordinates of the image. All drawing is done in a background thread onto an image, so complicated and long running drawing can be done without locking the UI. Drawing is done by overriding the paintWork(java.awt.Graphics, int, int, jsat.graphing.ProgressPanel) method.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • paintWork

        protected void paintWork(java.awt.Graphics g,
             int imageWidth,
             int imageHeight,
             ProgressPanel pp)
        Performs the drawing of the content to be displayed, indicating the width and height that should be used. The width and height may differ from the value returned by JComponent.getWidth(), since drawing will continue while a resize is in progress.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context to draw with
        imageWidth - the width to assume for the drawing area
        imageHeight - the height to assume for the drawing area
        pp - a progress panel, which may be null, to use to indicate the current progress in drawing.

      • toXCord

        public int toXCord(double x)
        This method takes an input numeric value and converts it into the appropriate pixel index location along the x axis. It assume the current component width returned by JComponent.getWidth() is correct.
        Parameters:
        x - the numeric value to convert to a pixel value
        Returns:
        the integer index that this point would be located at on the x axis

        Returns:

      • drawFunction

        protected void drawFunction(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                Function func)

      • drawPoint

        protected void drawPoint(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
             Graph2D.PointShape pointShape,
             double xPos,
             double yPos,
             double size,
             boolean fill)
        Draws a point object using the specified graphics object, using floating point values of the pixel coordinates.
        Parameters:
        pointShape - the shape type to draw
        xPos - the pixel position of the point on the x axis
        yPos - the pixel position of the point on the y axis
        size - the diameter of the point.
        fill - true to fill the point as a solid color, false to draw a hollow point.
        g2 - the graphics object to draw with

      • drawPoint

        protected void drawPoint(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
             Graph2D.PointShape pointShape,
             double xValue,
             double yValue,
             int width,
             int height,
             double size,
             boolean fill)
        Draws a point object using the specified graphics object, using numeric value locations.
        Parameters:
        g2 - the graphics object to draw with
        xValue - the numeric value on the x axis
        yValue - the numeric value on the y axis
        size - the diameter of the point to draw
        fill - true to fill the point as a solid color, false to draw a hollow point.
        pointShape - the shape type to draw
        height - the height of the assumed image
        width - the width of the assumed image

      • drawKey

        protected void drawKey(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
           int pos,
           java.util.List<java.lang.String> names,
           java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors)
        Draws a key / legend in one of the corners of the plot.
        Parameters:
        g2 - the graphics object to draw with
        pos - the corner to draw in. 0 for top left, 1 for top right, 2 for bottom left, and 3 for bottom right.
        names - the names, in order, to put in the key
        colors - the color to draw for each name, in order

      • drawKey

        protected void drawKey(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
           int pos,
           java.util.List<java.lang.String> names,
           java.util.List<java.awt.Color> colors,
           java.util.List<Graph2D.PointShape> shapes)
        Draws a key / legend in one of the corners of the plot.
        Parameters:
        g2 - the graphics object to draw with
        pos - the corner to draw in. 0 for top left, 1 for top right, 2 for bottom left, and 3 for bottom right.
        names - the names, in order, to put in the key
        colors - the color to draw for each name, in order
        shapes - the shape to place next to each name. May be null, in which no shapes will be drawn

        protected javax.swing.JPopupMenu getPopupMenu()
        Creates a new popup menu to show when someone right clicks on the component.
        Returns:
        the popup menu to show when someone right clicks on the component.
